alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 9:57AM EDT until July 26 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Johnson County in northeastern Kentucky... Martin County in northeastern Kentucky... Northeastern Floyd County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 100 PM EDT. * At 957 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Inez, Warfield, Davella, Davisport, Delong, Pleasant, Pevier, Debord, Prince, Preece, Bradbury, Odds, McClure, Moree, Dicks Creek, Wells Chapel, Boons Camp and Andy. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
